sense.name: immerse briefly into liquid or container
sense.commentary: NOTE: Nothing is necessarily getting removed from the container, except as a result (not intentional action) of the dipping, as in example 2.
sense.examples: Dip the garment into the cleaning solution. She dipped her donut into the coffee. He dipped into the pool. Marta dipped her hand into her purse.

sense.name: lower, decrease , or move downward, often momentarily
sense.examples: The plane dipped and flew on. The horse dipped its head. The sun dipped below the horizon. Stocks dipped for the third day in row today following early signs of improvement.

sense.name: be in a downward sloping position
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[theme] DIP PP[directional] NOTE: compare carefully to sense 2; this sense describes the state or shape or form of the direction; there is no actual movement
sense.examples: Our property dips towards the river. The pass dips down about 2000 feet, and then back up again.

sense.name: scoop up, as if with a ladle
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] DIP NP2[theme] PP[location] NOTE: compare carefully to sense 6; in this sense, you must state the substance being removed. Ie, 'He dipped into the container' does not entail that water was removed. Also, the 'source' is a location, not a resource.
sense.examples: He dipped water out of the container. She was dipping soup from the pot.

sense.name: DIP INTO: investigate superficially, skim
sense.examples: I enjoy dipping into Chaucer once in awhile. She dipped into psychology briefly while in college. I was rather pleased to discover that I had read 50 of them and dipped into another two or three.

sense.name: DIP INTO: pull from a resource
sense.commentary: Is: DIP INTO Syntax Is: NP1[agent] DIP INTO NP2[patient] NOTE: compare carefully to sense 4; in this sense, the 'resource' cannot be substituted with the thing 'taken out' *(not good) 'We dipped money from our savings account.'
sense.examples: Enron dipped into reserves to drive up earnings. We dipped into our savings. Cosmo dipped into our booty bank (aka tons of hot guys) to find the hottest mattress moves. He had to dip into funds that had been allocated for the initiative's second phase. There are also extra toiletries, which I had to dip into when I realized I'd forgotten my razor.

sense.name: make candles by immersing wick in wax
sense.examples: Using original tools and techniques, she dyes wool, weaves, and dips candles.

sense.name: disinfect an animal
sense.commentary: NOTE: this may be interpreted as a domain-specific subsense of sense 1 (the animals are immersed in liquid, but it is specifically for the purpose of disinfection)
sense.examples: We dipped the dog for fleas. I rode the horses, herded the cows, and clipped and dipped the sheep.

sense.name: switch headlights to a lower beam
sense.examples: Harry dipped the headlights and the two cars passed in silence.
